snippet: Previously unissued works by the Beatles, Bob Dylan and others will be released, albeit in very limited editions, to safeguard their European copyright protections.
lead_paragraph: Previously unissued works by the Beatles, Bob Dylan and others will be released, albeit in very limited editions, to safeguard their European copyright protections.
abstract: New European Union copyright law extends copyright protection to 70 years for recordings that were published within 50 years of being made, prompting record labels to release batches of rare, unissued material; many such releases are extremely limited editions, unpublicized, and available for only short time.

headline.main: European Copyright Laws Lead to Rare Music Releases
headline.print_headline: European Copyright Laws Lead to Rare Music Releases
